title: Find relative maxima given the derivative

content.question: The derivative of the function f is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qaceWGMbGbauaadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiab g2da9iaadIhapaWaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaaG4maaaakiabgkHiTiaais daciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiEa8aadaahaaWc beqaa8qacaaIYaaaaaGccaGLOaGaayzkaaGaey4kaSIaaGymaaaa@469F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>2.5</mn></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaqadaWdaeaapeGaeyOeI0IaaGOmaiaac6cacaaI1aGaaiila8aa caaMe8+dbiaaikdacaGGUaGaaGynaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@3F61@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, at which of the following values of x does f have a relative maximum?
